Articles.Content:
I'm not sure if there is anything I can do...do some parts like this are pitch black. Is there anything I can do? 

Edited January 23, 2016 by Rocket_Guy24
It looks like you need to redownload KSP, or verify your cache on Steam.
It said 2 files failed to verify, i redid the process  again and it said it had zero. It didn't work

Okay @Rocket_Guy24, please start KSP, close it, then find your output_log.txt, you can find more information on that here.

Also, run dxdiag from the start menus "run" box, and save the hardware report.

Put both of these on a file share site such as dropbox.com and post the share link here.
DiaX file... Still trying to figure out how to find output log https://drive.google.com/file/d/0ByfN69uQygSXRkR1MFpEajV3ZWc/view?usp=sharing

Unfortunately this may be caused by your Intel graphics chip, it has no memory of its own and is sharing the system RAM (currently it has only 256 megabytes), so there is limited memory for KSP's textures which explains why some are not able to display.

The amount of memory dedicated to the graphics chip can usually be changed in the Bios (see your computers manual for details).

Also your drivers are woefully out of date, you may be able to improve matters by updating the graphics driver, you can get the latest driver for this chip here on the Intel driver website, you will have to reboot the PC after the driver has finished installing.

If that does not help then you should consider buying a separate graphics card.
Thanks.figured it was my crappy PC
